comments:
Eclipse 3.0.2 worked on my Windows XP a few weeks ago, but then I had to 
reinstall Windows and everything else. I installed J2SE 1.4 SDK in the D:\Java 
directory, and then extracted the Eclipse package into D:\Java\Eclipse. When I 
first tried to start it it crashed saying I should read the log file, and ever 
since then it won't start. I didn't install any plugins. I tried starting 
Eclipse with the "clean" parameter, like this:

eclipse.exe -vmargs -Dosgi.checkConfiguration=true

but it still crashed. This is the log file from 1 minute ago, being started 
without any parameters:

I wonder about:
> java.version=1.4.0-beta
Does Eclipse work with JDK < 1.4.2???
I would suggest to install at least the latest 1.4.2_08 version, instead of 1.4.
0 beta and re-test.

Officially, Eclipse 3.0 requires Sun Java 1.4.2_03 or IBM Java 1.4.1.  Any VM
equal or newer than that should work.  Please reopen if you still have problems
with such a VM.
